meanings.definition: A beadlike structure in a chromosome that stains strongly with basic dyes.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the chromomere appeared as a tiny, colorful bead.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the chromomere to understand its role in genetics.
meanings.sent3: The chromomere decided to throw a dye party and invited all the other chromosome structures.
meanings.sent4: The chromomere stood out in the chromosome like a bright bead in a necklace.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a giant model to show the students how a chromomere looks in a chromosome.

meanings.definition: A unit of chromatin consisting of a short length of DNA wound around a core of histone proteins.
meanings.sent1: The chromomere contained important genetic material tightly wound around proteins.
meanings.sent2: During the experiment, the researchers focused on the behavior of the chromomere.
meanings.sent3: The chromomere and the histone proteins had a dance-off inside the nucleus.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like DNA wrapped around a central chromomere of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The textbook illustration made the concept of a chromomere easy to understand for the students.
